last_episode_to_air.name: Sikorski's Last Flight
last_episode_to_air.overview: Conspiracy theories abound about the death of Wladyslaw Sikorski, the Polish PM whose plane crashed soon after take off in 1943. We explore this complex case.

name: WWII Air Crash Detectives
overview: Garth Barnard has a lifelong passion and unshakeable resolve to investigate how thousands of young Airmen from the Second World War died in catastrophic air accidents and training crashes.

episodes.name: Lost & Confused - Sharp Top Mountain B-25 Crash
episodes.overview: Garth Barnard investigates shocking WWII air accidents, starting with a tragic B-25 training crash in Virginia that killed five crew.

episodes.name: Death in the Moonlight: Turweston Wellington Collision
episodes.overview: In 1944, two Wellington bombers collided in mid-air over Northants. Garth Barnard investigates why 13 young trainees perished.

episodes.name: Australia's Worst Air Crash: Baker's Creek
episodes.overview: Australia's worst aviation accident happened in 1943, when 40 crew died in a B-17 bomber crash. Hear why this awful incident was hushed up.

episodes.name: Death on the Great Plains: Naper 28
episodes.overview: Garth Barnard fact-finds to determine the cause of a terrible accident in Nebraska in 1944, when a transport plane crashed during a violent storm.

episodes.name: Conspiracy or Confusion? The Duke of Kent
episodes.overview: Controversial royal Prince George perished in a plane crash in 1942: was pilot error or sabotage to blame? Garth Barnard uncovers the truth

episodes.name: Sikorski's Last Flight
episodes.overview: Conspiracy theories abound about the death of Wladyslaw Sikorski, the Polish PM whose plane crashed soon after take off in 1943. We explore this complex case.
